channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024072140
item.description:
Report X-2024072140

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024072140 Package arrived at hub QA in a red Haz tote. Upon further inspection found outer packaging soiled and stained from internal contents leaking due to loose caps and dented body. 2. X-2024072143 Plastic pail arrived at hub QA in a red Haz tote. Upon further inspection found pail soiled, the body bent, and empty from missing cap on top of pail. 3. X-2024072149 Plastic pail arrived at hub QA in a red Haz tote. Upon further inspection found pail soiled and stained from loose closure on top of pail. 4. X-2024072151 attachment Name:Hazmat-Undeclared HazMat Package Disposition 04302024.pdf. 5. X-2024072152 Plastic pail arrived at hub QA in a red Haz tote. Upon further inspection found pail soiled and stained from loose closure on top of pail.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDERS WERE CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE FLOOR OUTSIDE THE TRAILER. UPON RETURNING TO THE CAGE AND OPENING THE PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON; NO LEAK; ALSO DISCOVERED UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report E-2024070677
item.description:
Report E-2024070677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: VINCENNES
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of AMERLOCK 600 LIGHT TINT BASE released from (10) 1-gallon metal cans due to improper loading (came in with a 1,000-pound skid on top of it). The release was contained to the cardboard boxes and nothing impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel had already completely cleaned and containerized the spill into a metal drum prior to ERTS notification.
